intro: Sedum bulliardii, commonly known as the Bulliard's stonecrop, is a species of flowering plant in the family Crassulaceae. It is a low-growing succulent that typically forms dense mats of fleshy, blue-green leaves. Native to the mountainous regions of Mexico, it thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow to orange during the summer months. It is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
